column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=I read that .
#Text=Yeah , yeah , I 'm pretty excited about that .
#Text=Maybe we can get some attention for a prospect that would really work .
#Text=Is it pretty gratifying for you to work with people on the other side of the aisle to try and find solutions ?
#Text=It is , because I think it defies what the country views Washington as being , which is as so hopelessly polarized that it ca n't get anything done .
#Text=It shows some hope that even on tough issues like Iraq , we can get things done .
#Text=So I think it gives some hope to the country , too , when we do things like that .

#Text=I remember sort of the old days where you 'd hear about Ted Kennedy being best friends with Orrin Hatch ; do you think that the Tom DeLay period ushered in an era where people were too opposed to each other on the sides of the aisle ?
#Text=Oh , I think we too often look for ways to fight , rather than ways to get along .
#Text=And that 's been a feature in recent years .

#Text=Yeah , maybe that time is coming to a bit of an end as people have such low opinions of Congress and of politics , that maybe people will start finding these ways forward , and people will reward folks for doing that .
#Text=We 'll see .
#Text=I do n't know that the divisive period is over , but it does strike some interest in people when you do do it .
#Text=Maybe we can .

#Text=Running for President has to be a grueling experience , and there must be a million things that you see out there when you 're on the road that either you had not thought about before or you did n't know existed .
#Text=Could you tell me about one ?
#Text=Well , you know , I just heard one .

#Text=I was doing a big NPR interview with a group out of Boston , doing a call-in , and I had a couple of callers coming from the left in the political spectrum talking about their willingness to more engage in a discussion of faith and cut back on abortion .

#Text=I thought it was very encouraging -- and these are quite sincere people -- part of what they 're looking for in the Democratic party is more of a way forward on tough issues that have been divisive .
#Text=I found that very encouraging .
#Text=That 's great .

#Text=Throughout my life , my father , who is an avid lifelong Republican , he used to tell me -- this is a question that I 'd asked Tom Tancredo as well , but I think it really comes down to one of the central issues in this race -- he had said , " All we need is a Republican Congress , a Republican Senate , and a Republican White House to get the country on the right track . "
#Text=And last year , he expressed to me that he was very disappointed with where things have gone with the Republicans running things .

#Text=He feels let down ; he feels like he was lied to by the Party , either through the rationale for the Iraq war , the sex and bribery scandals , the pork barrel projects , and , as Alan Greenspan said , the fiscal irresponsibility .
#Text=He feels like there have been many broken promises .
#Text=Why should someone like my father vote Republican today ?
#Text=And I can assure you he will .
#Text=But why do you think he should ?
